text: it is an issue that polarizes opinion in
Island now set to be the subject of a
referendum on changing the law at the
moment thousands of women travel
overseas to terminate their pregnancy
every year or by abortion pills online
taken at home without medical support or
supervision
now politicians have agreed to hold a
referendum on whether the laws on
abortion should be changed we already
have abortion in Ireland but it's unsafe
unregulated and unlawful and in my
opinion we kind of continue to export
our problems and import our solutions as
tea Stoker's medical doctor as a former
minister for health I don't believe we
can persist with the situation whereby
women in crisis are risking their lives
through the use of unregulated medicines
pro-life groups here believe the laws on
abortion shouldn't be changed but
campaigners want to see it
decriminalized and polls suggest that
most people would vote to change the law
and make abortion legal in some
circumstances now Islands Health
Minister will draft a bill to amend the
country's constitution in time for a
vote at the end of May and replant BBC
news
